title: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ludwig.api'; 'ludwig' is not a package
body:
**Describe the bug**
Despite creating, activating, and pip installing ludwig in a conda environment, cannot import into python script.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Created new conda environment
2. Activated said environment
3. pip install ludwig, success
4. Can use ludwig in command line, but cannot import into script (using VSCode)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97319052/148619278-5f61e1d4-49bd-4c54-bbdd-bf77af9b8a49.png)
This is my code:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97319052/148619693-4e561d8b-a40d-4cc0-85bb-6691d88a92c5.png)
Confirming the interpreter:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97319052/148619725-dca8a89a-cbd8-4cf9-93f2-00121b21fc16.png)
Edit: Confirming my site-packages:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97319052/148620274-db2a9960-8ab9-4b74-9b5f-3e893d1462a7.png)
Edit2: Ok this must be a VSCode issue because Anaconda Prompt is working
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97319052/148620399-1f821649-0bee-4df0-9d8c-67796b000b63.png)

- OS: Win10Pro
- Version: Build 19042
- Python: 3.9.7 64 bit
- Ludwig: 0.4

**Additional context**
Maybe this is a conda problem? Pandas and numpy work fine though...sorry if this is the wrong place to ask!
